titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tim Davenport Oral History Collection TAM.738
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-11-30 15:11:58 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: Tim Davenport is an independent scholar from Corvallis, Oregon, specializing in 1920s American radicalism. He maintains the Early American Marxism website and volunteers for the Marxist Internet archive. This collection consists of nine open-reel audiotapes of oral history interviews, including seven reels with sound recordings of John Calvin Taylor interviewing Ralph E. Shaffer, Professor Emeritus of History at Cal Poly Pomona, on the subject of radicalism, socialist organizing, and student activism in California. The collection also includes two reels with sound recordings of Shaffer interviewing Grace Brewer of San Pedro, California.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Tim Davenport in 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2017.069.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor. Reels of interviews between John Calvin Taylor and Ralph E. Shaffer are arranged by number written on the reel container.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Tim Davenport (1961- ) is an independent scholar from Corvallis, Oregon, specializing in 1920s American radicalism. He maintains the Early American Marxism website and volunteers for the Marxist Internet archive.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Tim Davenport Oral History Collection; TAM 738; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, reels were housed in an archival box and described on the collection-level with an item-level inventory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of nine open-reel audiotapes of oral history interviews, including seven reels with sound recordings of John Calvin Taylor interviewing Ralph E. Shaffer, Professor Emeritus of History at Cal Poly Pomona, on the subject of radicalism, socialist organizing, and student activism in California. The collection also includes two reels with sound recordings of Shaffer interviewing Grace Brewer of San Pedro, California.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Tim Davenport, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2017 by Tim Davenport. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/.
